alert.note: Alert for Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 12:36AM CDT until July 03 at 6:45AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following county, Texas. * WHEN...Until 645 AM CDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1236 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Piney River at Union Road and Big Piney River at Cleveland Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Houston, Raymondville, Solo, Yukon, Bucyrus and Eunice. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
